Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.function.provider

Class TerminologyFunctions

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.function.provider.TerminologyFunctions
public abstract class TerminologyFunctions extends Object
Functions for querying terminology from FHIRPath expressions.
Author:
Piotr Szul, John Grimes

  • Method Details

    • display

      @Nonnull public static StringCollection display(@Nonnull CodingCollection input, @Nullable StringCollection language)
      When invoked on a Coding, returns the preferred display term, according to the terminology server.

      The optional language parameter can be used to specify the preferred language for the display name.

      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings
      language - The preferred language for the display name
      Returns:
      A collection of display names
      See Also:
      • Pathling documentation - display
      • TerminologyConfiguration.getAcceptLanguage()

    • property

      @Nonnull public static Collection property(@Nonnull CodingCollection input, @Nonnull StringCollection code, @Nullable StringCollection type, @Nullable StringCollection language)
      When invoked on a Coding, returns any matching property values, using the specified name and type parameters.

      The type parameter has these possible values:

      • string (default)
      • code
      • Coding
      • integer
      • boolean
      • DateTime
      Both the code and the type of the property must be present within a lookup response in order for it to be returned by this function. If there are no matches, the function will return an empty collection.

      The optional language parameter can be used to specify the preferred language for the returned property values. It overrides the default value set in the configuration.

      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings
      code - The name of the property to retrieve
      type - The type of the property to retrieve
      language - The preferred language for the property values
      Returns:
      A collection of property values
      See Also:
      • Pathling documentation - property
      • TerminologyConfiguration.getAcceptLanguage()

    • designation

      @Nonnull public static StringCollection designation(@Nonnull CodingCollection input, @Nullable CodingCollection use, @Nullable StringCollection language)
      When invoked on a collection of Coding elements, returns a collection of designation values from the lookup operation. This can be used to retrieve synonyms, language translations and more from the underlying terminology.

      If the use parameter is specified, designation values are filtered to only those with a matching use. If the language parameter is specified, designation values are filtered to only those with a matching language. If both are specified, designation values must match both the specified use and language.

      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings
      use - The optional use parameter
      language - The optional language parameter
      Returns:
      A collection of designation values
      See Also:
      • Pathling documentation - designation
      • FHIR specification - Display, Definition and Designations

    • memberOf

      @Nonnull public static BooleanCollection memberOf(@Nonnull TerminologyConcepts input, @Nonnull StringCollection valueSetURL)
      This function can be invoked on a collection of Coding or CodeableConcept values, returning a collection of Boolean values based on whether each concept is a member of the ValueSet with the specified url.

      For a CodeableConcept, the function will return true if any of the codings are members of the value set.

      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings or CodeableConcepts
      valueSetURL - The URL of the ValueSet to check membership against
      Returns:
      A collection of boolean values
      See Also:
      • Pathling documentation - memberOf

    • subsumes

      @Nonnull public static BooleanCollection subsumes(@Nonnull TerminologyConcepts input, @Nonnull TerminologyConcepts codes)
      This function takes a collection of Coding or CodeableConcept elements as input, and another collection as the argument. The result is a collection with a Boolean value for each source concept, each value being true if the concept subsumes any of the concepts within the argument collection, and false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings or CodeableConcepts
      codes - The collection of Codings or CodeableConcepts to check against
      Returns:
      A collection of boolean values
      See Also:
      • FHIR specification - Additional functions

    • subsumedBy

      @Nonnull public static BooleanCollection subsumedBy(@Nonnull TerminologyConcepts input, @Nonnull TerminologyConcepts codes)
      This is the inverse of the subsumes(au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.TerminologyConcepts, au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.TerminologyConcepts) function, examining whether each input concept is subsumed by any of the argument concepts.
      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings or CodeableConcepts
      codes - The collection of Codings or CodeableConcepts to check against
      Returns:
      A collection of boolean values
      See Also:
      • FHIR specification - Additional functions

    • translate

      @Nonnull public static CodingCollection translate(@Nonnull TerminologyConcepts input, @Nonnull StringCollection conceptMapUrl, @Nullable BooleanCollection reverse, @Nullable StringCollection equivalence, @Nullable StringCollection target)
      When invoked on a Coding, returns any matching concepts using the ConceptMap specified using conceptMapUrl.

      The reverse parameter controls the direction to traverse the map - false results in "source to target" mappings, while true results in "target to source".

      The equivalence parameter is a comma-delimited set of values from the ConceptMapEquivalence ValueSet, and is used to filter the mappings returned to only those that have an equivalence value in this list.

      The target parameter identifies the value set in which a translation is sought â€” a scope for the translation.

      Parameters:
      input - The input collection of Codings
      conceptMapUrl - The URL of the ConceptMap to use
      reverse - The optional reverse parameter
      equivalence - The optional equivalence parameter
      target - The optional target parameter
      Returns:
      A collection of Codings
      See Also:
      • Pathling documentation - translate
